bug.short_desc: Allow for suppression of "Unknown class referenced" messages, e.g. for dynamically created classes

long_desc.thetext:
In one of my classes, I create an object dynamically
obj = new qcl.access[typeLower][typeUpper](name);
which will create, for example, an instance of qcl.access.permission.Permission
When I run "generator.py source", the generator complains
>>> Resolving dependencies... - ! Unknown class referenced: qcl
The warning will not have any negative effects, however, it would be good if one could have a way to mark in the source that this is not a non-existing class.

See the corresponding discussion on the mailing list for possible workarounds (that Christian is already using): http://www.nabble.com/Generator-question%3A-Unknown-clas-referenced-td24099601.html
As per Thomas' request, this bug is kept as an enhancement to address the following:
"There is currently no way of specifically disabling these kind of warnings, but it's good you mentioned it, there probably should be one. Could you open a bug for it?! Would you want to disable it in the config, or in the code? - The only way to suppress these warnings currently is to use the '-q' switch when invoking the generator."
Move open issues to RESOLVED â€“ LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
